result.execSummary:
The defendant Alex S Pernsteiner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay Forfeiture totalling $210.80 within 60 days or call to set up a payment plan within 60 days.  Failure to pay will result in a Judgment being entered and collected by WI State Debt Collections
.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alex S Pernsteiner

records.addlTxt: Stipulated Plea & Order e/signed by TWB:  Def pleads GUILTY to charge of Ordinance Violation Disorderly Conduct 9.947.01.  This is a non-criminal offense.  Def is ordered to pay a Forfeiture totalling $210.80 w/ 60 days to pay or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will result in Judgment being entered and collected by WI State Debt Collections

State by Donskey by video /  Def by video w/ Atty Skemp by video / T.P. by video
CRT:  Set for Bail/Bond hrg - issues concerning child
Skemp:  comments on injunction/stipulation filed that states if parties agree to placement arrangement, it is not violation of injunction.  Officers in Bangor were not aware of that, def playing w/ child in front yard & was arrested.  TP told them there was no violation but officer said that was not how they look at injunction & def was arrested
CRT comments on No Contact on bond & child exchange thru Family Wizard.  There is a note that states contact thru Family Wizard.  Comments on Injunction - bond is not clear
Skemp:  Proposal is that if parties agree to have contact @ TP house, they be allowed to do that
CRT comments on taking no contact off bond.  Injunction is in place thru January.  If they communicate thru Family Wizard & she invites him over, it is in writing
Donskey:  not my case.  This sounds reasonable to protect TP when she wants it
CRT addresses TP about dropping No Contact on bond
TP:  yes, that works
CRT addresses placement in family case
Def understands - agrees.  Gives current phone # to CRT
CRT:  $500 SIGNATURE BOND AUTHORIZED BY CRT TO COVER 22CM296 & UNCHARGED BOND (#64522).  NO CONTACT IS REMOVED FROM BOND.  CONDITIONS:  NO ALCOHOL
Pre-trial Hrg on 9-2-2022 to remain on calendar
CRT:  new Intake Date of 9-13-2022 @ 2 pm (for uncharged case)
Clerks to update def's phone number
Def's Motion for Clarification & Modification of bond
Bail/bond hearing on July 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Def w/Atty Skemp
$500 sig bond set w/same cond and modify: contact regarding child exchange through the family wizard - refund cash
Def stands mute - not guilty plea entered.
Status: 11/3 2 8:30 (TWB)
PTCDA: 9/2 @ 2:30
Status conference on November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
